snippet: Jason Kubler seeks to move up the rankings by playing clay-court tournaments and preserving his injury-prone knees.
abstract: Australian tennis player Jason Kubler is one of few in sport who plays exclusively on clay courts, which are more forgiving to his injury-prone knees; adopted strategy early in his career, noting that it will give him better chance for a longer run when he does transition to hardcourts.
lead_paragraph: Jason Kubler seeks to move up the rankings by playing clay-court tournaments and preserving his injury-prone knees.

headline.main: A Player’s All-Clay Schedule Aids His Career, and Knees
headline.print_headline: Australian’s All-Clay Schedule Requires Sacrifices, but It Also Preserves His Knees
